title: 'This terrifying face is the true face of war': A new lease on life for Ukraine's 'broken faces'
summary: Soldiers and civilians left disfigured, and then stigmatized, by the ravages of war, are being treated, free of charge, by the Unburned program, run by 33 clinics across the country.

title: Tens of thousands took to the streets in France against racism and the rise of the far right
summary: Some protesters, in Paris and cities across the country, took aim at the US administration and others carrying Palestinian flags.

title: At least 8 killed in Israeli strikes on Lebanon after rocket fire
summary: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu and Defense Minister Israel Katz ordered 'a second wave of strikes against dozens of Hezbollah targets in Lebanon,' in response to a rocket attack, the defense ministry said.  Hezbollah denied any involvement.

title: Vast crowds in Istanbul in support of arrested mayor for the fourth night of protests
summary: The demonstrations, which began in Istanbul on Wednesday, have since spread to more than 55 of Turkey's 81 provinces, sparking clashes with riot police in the country's worst street protests in more than a decade.

title: US: Trump administration revokes legal migrant status for 500,000 people
summary: These people had lawfully come to the US under a Joe Biden-era program for Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans, and Venezuelans. They will lose legal protections 30 days after the order is published, amid the Trump administration's mass deportation campaign.

title: Pope Francis is due to make first public appearance on Sunday
summary: After a stretch in the Agostino Gemelli hospital due to pneumonia in both lungs, the longest hospitalization of his papacy, Pope Francis is due to wave and offer a blessing from the hospital after Angelus prayers on Sunday.

title: In Israel, opposition calls for general strike over security chief dismissal
summary: The unprecedented move to fire Shin Bet chief Ronen Bar has deepened divisions in the country as Israel resumes its military operations in the Gaza Strip. Tens of thousands of people protested in Tel Aviv Saturday.

title: The Salève cable car, vertiginous architecture
summary: A balcony suspended above the landscape, a restaurant opening up onto wide-open spaces, a panoramic terrace: The project, by Devaux & Devaux Architects, in France's Alpine southeast offers visitors an intense sensory experience.

title: How a French researcher being refused entry to the US turned into a diplomatic mess
summary: The US administration stated that the scientist had sensitive data on his computer and phone, contradicting the version of events put forward by the French research minister, who had publicized the incident.

title: Israel: Power struggle between government and judiciary thrusts the country into the unknown
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet voted unanimously on Friday to dismiss Ronen Bar, head of Israel's domestic intelligence service. The Supreme Court suspended the legally dubious procedure, and their decision was supported by the Attorney General. The prime minister has decided to force the issue.

title: IS jailers trial: The anti-Western, pro-Russian rhetoric of Mehdi Nemmouche, sentenced to life in prison
summary: A few hours before the verdict was delivered on Friday, defendant Mehdi Nemmouche, who claimed to be a 'terrorist,' seized on the platform the trial represented to launch into a violent anti-Western diatribe, inspired by jihadist and Kremlin propaganda.

title: Heathrow Airport back to 'fully operational' after fire
summary: Flights began landing at Europe's biggest airport around 7 pm on Friday night, after a fire on Thursday night had knocked out power at the London airport, leading to thousands of delays and a backlog of flights to clear.

title: Bird flu:  US Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. dismays scientists by suggesting to let the virus run
summary: The idea, taken up by the Secretary of State for Agriculture, Brooke Rollins, worries scientists and veterinarians alike. It would give the virus the opportunity to mutate and become more dangerous.

title: Getting outdoors, mixing work and pleasure and cheaper trips: How Covid (partly) changed tourism in France
summary: While the sector has been on a roller-coaster ride over the past five years, it hasn't really switched course since the pandemic. However, new types of behaviors linked to a yearning for nature, inflation and the rise of remote work have taken hold.

title: Turkey: Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu's arrest marks the start of a new authoritarian era
summary: By arresting his main political opponent, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is transforming his regime into a true autocracy. Major demonstrations have taken place in many cities across the country.

title: The two opposing views of October 7 and its aftermath
summary: Depending on whether you see the terrorist massacre as an episode in a conflict that has been going on since 1948 or as the start of a new era that abolishes previous parameters, the perception of the war between Israel and Hamas changes radically.

title: 'The Alto Knights,' a decrepit Mafia duel between De Niro and himself
summary: Barry Levinson stages a confrontation between two crime bosses, played by the actor, who delivers a double, laborious performance.

title: Five activities around Paris to get teens to finally put down their phones
summary: It's not always easy to get young people out of bed. From skateboarding to cinema, street art and fashion, here's our selection of outings and workshops designed just for them, in the Paris region. Just the thing to (temporarily) combat laziness.
